```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
# Load required packages
library(tidyverse)
library(skimr)
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)
library(knitr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(summarytools)
library(readxl)  # Since you're working with Excel files
library(here)    # Load the here package

# Set working directory relative to the project root
knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir = here::here())

# Create directories for output if they don't exist
dir.create("outputs/visuals", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)
dir.create("outputs/summary_tables", recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)

```

```{r}
# Define the path to the merged datasets folder
merged_data_folder <- here("merged datasets")

# List the files in the folder to confirm they're being detected correctly
dataset_files <- list.files(merged_data_folder, pattern = "*.csv$", full.names = TRUE)

# Debugging step: Print the files to ensure they're detected
print("Found the following files:")
print(dataset_files)

# Check if the files exist
stopifnot(length(dataset_files) > 0, "No CSV files found in 'merged datasets' folder!")

# Load all merged data files (GroupA, GroupB, GroupC, GroupD)
groupA_data <- read_csv(dataset_files[1])  # First file for GroupA
groupB_data <- read_csv(dataset_files[2])  # Second file for GroupB
groupC_data <- read_csv(dataset_files[3])  # Third file for GroupC
groupD_data <- read_csv(dataset_files[4])  # Fourth file for GroupD


```
```{r}
# Display the first 5 rows of Group A's data
kable(head(groupA_data), caption = "First 5 Rows of Group A Data")

# Repeat for other groups if needed
kable(head(groupB_data), caption = "First 5 Rows of Group B Data")
kable(head(groupC_data), caption = "First 5 Rows of Group C Data")
kable(head(groupD_data), caption = "First 5 Rows of Group D Data")
```



```{r}
# Summary statistics for Group A data
summary(groupA_data)

# Repeat for other groups
summary(groupB_data)
summary(groupC_data)
summary(groupD_data)


```

```{r}
# Missing values in Group A
missing_groupA <- colSums(is.na(groupA_data))
cat("Missing values in Group A:\n", missing_groupA, "\n")

# Duplicates in Group A
duplicates_groupA <- sum(duplicated(groupA_data))
cat("Number of duplicate rows in Group A:", duplicates_groupA, "\n")

# Repeat for other groups if needed


```

```{r}
# Example visualization: Distribution of a specific variable in Group A
ggplot(groupA_data, aes(x = variable_of_interest)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10) + 
  labs(title = "Distribution of Variable in Group A")

# Save the plot
ggsave("outputs/visuals/groupA_variable_plot.png")

```
